website_summaries.verdict: A good cooling option for most modern CPUs from AMD and Intel. Good for extreme gaming.
pros: Dual fan setup helps to cool off liquid more quickly than other options
Pump circulates water quickly to keep the system working efficiently
cons: Varied results depending on the case side
Larger cases make it difficult to mount the radiator effectively

customer_reviews.title: I am an experienced PC builder and have never had in 15 years a problem this bad.
customer_reviews.text: Bought in March 2018 and it is less than 3 months old. Used the AIO in a Corsair 250D case so the motherboard and AIO were horizontal. Yesterday my PC stopped working. To make a long story short, upon removal of the AIO, I could see that the cpu was wet and the motherboard socket was filled with fluid. I believe both are fried. Needless to say this a total nightmare. I am an experienced PC builder and have never had in 15 years a problem this bad.
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: My choice for Ryzen APUs
customer_reviews.text: Ryzen 2200g Apu CPU 3.9ghz GPU 1600mhz Total TDP of the APU is around 95 watts under full load. The heat blew the stock cooler away with 90+ celcius withen a couple minutes. This cooler doesnt allow temps to go past 50. Idle is around 27 celcius on the aio vs. 45 on the stock cooler. Quality is very good. Mine arrived without any problems, and it looks pretty cool. You will be very happy with this cooler. Only thing I can criticize is the directions for the mounting. Its somewhat confusing since you have an Intel bag and an AMD bag but for the am4 platform you will use the contents within both.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: So far very happy.
customer_reviews.text: This is great. So far it's working very well. While gaming my Ryzen 1700X Stays about 35°C. Installation was a breeze. Pre-applied thermal paste made things easy and clean. One thing you'll need to note is if you plug it into the CPU Fan Motherboard connector you'll need to set it to manual mode and 100% for the pump to work all the time and the LED pulse to work. Maybe best to just plug straight into the PSU.
customer_reviews.author: Ambra Bruce

customer_reviews.title: Great price, not quite as good as corsair AIO cooler
customer_reviews.text: A little tricky to assemble but works well at a great price. I've used the corsair H60 and H90 previously which are a bit easier to install but not not enough to justify the price differential. The white light I originally had no interest in but now I really like it. Fans appear to be good quality but since I don't OC a lot I'm not sure how noisy (I've never heard them).
customer_reviews.author: Manuel Noriega

customer_reviews.title: Not For Me
customer_reviews.text: Bottom line is that it didn't keep my I7-8700K cpu at reasonable temperatures. Idle was constantly at 35+ C and load over 70 C. I re-seated it several times to no avail. Replaced it with a Corsair H110I which is working fine. This may work for some, but not for me. Another thought. The instructions are a series of pictures that require a little head scratching to understand. Not a major issue for me but if you need some text to help in installation, look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: OldnAchy

customer_reviews.title: Receinved defective unit and fried my CPU.
customer_reviews.text: Received defective unit. Sucessfully and properly installed. Fried my $105 CPU. Fans on radiator worked fine. Suspect bad water pump. Known good computer attempted to fire up a couple of times then started to shut down after a few seconds. Later would not even attempt to start. Removed and installed back my old conventional cooler. Computer ran but failed to start. Tried resetting my motherboard but that did not get my PC going again. In short; a very bad experience. Be ware. Question: can one tell if the water pump is running in a working unit? Am returning for refund. Having to order replacement CPU. For a critical computer component this should have been tested prior to being sent out.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: What I expected
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to go into system to reduce heat. Works as expected. The cooler is oversized once the fans are added, therefore; the fans are pushed up against the motherboard on a standard case. I would highly recommend a case that has the overhead for supporting raised fans/liquid cooling.
customer_reviews.author: missdeb.

customer_reviews.title: Easy install- cool looking in my open glass white Hackintosh case
customer_reviews.text: Easy install-(checked out a Ytube video to be sure) cool looking in my open glass white Hackintosh case, but only time will tell if liquid cooling will not leak?!!! Be sure to check to see if your case will accomodate this, as the tubes are not very flexible and placement locations will be limited as the tubing should not be wrangled around too much. (Wish I got blue colored led fans instead of white led though).
customer_reviews.author: SuzanneDel

customer_reviews.title: I think these AIOs are one of the best for the money
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Deepcool Captain. The first one came in my Genome case. I think these AIOs are one of the best for the money. They look great and I was able to get my FX 8350 to 4.7ghz as a daily OC. This one will be cooling my Ryzen 7 1700x. Looking forward to overclocking this already great CPU.
customer_reviews.author: Nick Santiago

customer_reviews.title: (With push&pull) it matches any Wii
customer_reviews.text: Coming from a 360mms aio with 6 push and pull fans I honestly thought I'd downgrade since my old one died on me. That being said this with the second best thermal grizzly thermal compound and two extra 1700rpm Noctua Redux for push and pull I managed a 28-35c Idle (in middle of summer in Cali no ac) i can't tell if the thermal paste is that amazing or the fans or the unit or all three needless to say it matches and even beats it in some cases by a few C for less than half the price.
customer_reviews.author: Danny Arvizu

customer_reviews.title: CPU is cool as it has ever been.
customer_reviews.text: I'm getting 50Cdegrees on Prime95 tests and 28C on idle. My old air cooler would get 88 degrees on Prime95. Was easy to install in NZXT case.
customer_reviews.author: fast650isfast

customer_reviews.title: Average performance, but good enough for the price - REPLACE THE PRE-APPLIED THERMAL PASTE
customer_reviews.text: Arrived on time - Pros - matched my black and white build perfectly - easy to install - appears to be good build quality Cons - fans are fairly noisy - does not cool cpu as well as previous Corsair h100 did Overall, it's probably about what I expected for the price. UPDATE - after removing and cleaning off the pre-applied thermal compound, I replaced it using Thermal Grizzly Kryonaut and got better thermal performance. I would not recommend using the pre-applied thermal compound.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Its big, like huge, but looks awsome.
customer_reviews.text: I funnaly got a water cooler for my pc! super simple set up. all in one contents, so no goofing with water and oils and bacteria killers. i purchased to to match the gtx 1060 pictured in an older system. i ended up having to drill some holes and buying some extra hardware >$3, and suspending it over the extra pcae slots. this is a small tower.
customer_reviews.author: Perry

customer_reviews.title: I9 9900k runs chilly
customer_reviews.text: Love the mounting design! Allows for removal once installed without taking the motherboard out to reapply thermal paste if needed. I9 9900k idle 28 c and playing Battlefield V 63 c max
customer_reviews.author: Tyler

customer_reviews.title: Cheap But Solid
customer_reviews.text: I'm cooling my Ryzen 3 2200G with the Captain 240EX now, after switching from AMD's stock cooler. Idle temps have gone down from around 40 C to 25-30 C, and I was able to Overclock the CPU to 4.15 GHz and still only max out at 50 C when stress testing thanks to the improved cooling. All around, the cooler is fantastic for the price. Point of advice: read the instructions. You're not getting anywhere without the manual, and like me, you'll have to swallow your pride and read it, haha.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Quality product, looks awesome.
customer_reviews.text: Works great, looks great. Nothing about it appears to be cheap only thing I would change if I could would be to have white hoses. Not that you need the instructions if you've installed one of these before, but the ones that come with the product are better than a bunch I've seen previously. I would buy again
customer_reviews.author: The Sharp

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for 1 Year Now
customer_reviews.text: This thing looks awesome and was one of the only black and white themed coolers when I got it. I read some of the horror stories but also read how DeepCool made it right. I love the look of this in my rig and it performs well enough for me. I'm mostly gaming on 1440p with a 1080ti
customer_reviews.author: Patrick H

customer_reviews.title: Cooler leaked ruining other parts
customer_reviews.text: Cooler leaked all over GPU and onto PCIe slot in motherboard after about 2 years of normal use. Will update review if support gets back to me to honor their warranty and replace my components. Update: It’s been a month since I’ve sent my damaged parts to them and haven’t heard back from them after sending multiple emails....
customer_reviews.author: Tyler

customer_reviews.title: Very well it did.
customer_reviews.text: Did install and made sure to level it and to test it for 2 hr to watch so it does not leak of the bottom so anyway it work like a champ and it was cool with the led lights.
customer_reviews.author: Gol_Sonaak

customer_reviews.title: Good product but LED already broken
customer_reviews.text: I've used Deepcool products before and generally like their quality but I just noticed that the white LED on the cpu block doesn't light up anymore which is a shame because its been only 6 weeks since I bought this. The pump is still working, thank God, but now I'm nervous about how long that will last and because I appear to be outside of the return/replace window, I'm stuck. Not a good thing.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Perdomo

customer_reviews.title: Does a good job at cooling, handle with care when installing.
customer_reviews.text: Take your time installing. Does have parts that are glass and can break. Mine works great, keeps my 2600x cool at all times. It’s pretty small, was able to fit it in a mid size tower
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Slick Looking Cooler
customer_reviews.text: After my Corsair H100i v2's pump stopped working after only year of operation this week, I did some research and landed on this guy. It looks good in an RGB case, was easy to install and is very, very quiet. The fan hub is a nice addition to the kit as well. I need to do some bench marking on it but right now in basic video streaming, web surfing and running Visual Studio, it sits around 33°C.
customer_reviews.author: TheMadTitan

customer_reviews.title: Leaked and ruined graphics card and motherboard
customer_reviews.text: It worked well for two months until coolant began leaking out of a seal on the waterblock and ruined my graphics card and motherboard. UPDATE I contacted DEEPCOOL support, and the customer service was excellent. DEEPCOOL fully reimbursed the graphics card and motherboard.
customer_reviews.author: NT

customer_reviews.title: Dead pump right out of the box.
customer_reviews.text: Headline says it all. Pump was DOA right out of the box. Deepcool customer support was non-existent. I went with this for the lower price and aesthetics of the white radiator/pump design, but I should've just gone with Corsair's more expensive options. At least their products work out of the box. Not purchasing a Deepcool product again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very good
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to install and works great. My oc i5-9600k stays at 60° under load and returns to 30° almost immediately.
customer_reviews.author: steve

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic watercooler. Was very easy to install and came packaged with an AM4 bracket which is nice. Went from load temperatures of about 65c to now at about 50c-55c at max settings in games. Would definitely recommend this cooler
customer_reviews.author: Josh D

customer_reviews.title: Leaky
customer_reviews.text: Leaked after almost exactly 1 year. Purchased on July 16 2018, leaked on my gpu July 24 2019. I would not trust this cooler.
customer_reviews.author: zmflyin

customer_reviews.title: Good no problems cooler.
customer_reviews.text: Works very well. At first i thought temps were way to high but after mobo firmware update correct temps displayed and i was pleasantly surprised. Make sure you get the updated version if your using fom AM4 socket or buy the adapter backplate.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: This model is only with the white led
customer_reviews.text: Used in my sons new pc build. Works great cools the amd 2700x just fine
customer_reviews.author: ProjectDraven

customer_reviews.title: Looks Amazing and keeps my CPU chilled
customer_reviews.text: Looks Great and is working exactly how its supposed to, keeping my CPU at a good temperature while under load :) If anything changes I’ll update this review :)
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Skeith

customer_reviews.title: Only allows 2 mounting positions on AM3/AM3+ mobos. Made ...
customer_reviews.text: Only allows 2 mounting positions on AM3/AM3+ mobos. Made it hard to mount the radiator. I was stuck with only 1 option, but it means I have to take off the block in order to do anything with the RAM slots. Fans are also loud on full blast. I'd look elsewhere if I where you.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fans look good but are junk.
customer_reviews.text: Fans died within a week, completely shut off. One died then a couple days later the other went with it. Other the. That the pump is quiet, keeps things cool after replacing with some sp120 fans.
customer_reviews.author: Corn snake

customer_reviews.title: Works great, Cools my AMD Ryzen 5 1600X
customer_reviews.text: Works great, Cools my AMD Ryzen 5 1600X. Was a little trying to mount in my Thermaltake Core X71 case.
customer_reviews.author: Alexander M.

customer_reviews.title: Boyfriend lovessssss!
customer_reviews.text: He works from home on his computer plus also a gamer. He loved this definitely helped speed up his conputer.
customer_reviews.author: Kendra

customer_reviews.title: So far so good with my ryzen 1700
customer_reviews.text: So far so good with my ryzen 1700. Ive had it for about 4 months and it does what i nees ti to do.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: So far it's cool.
customer_reviews.text: 6 months in and going strong. Keeps my ryzen 1700x nice and cool. Easy to install and looks awesome in white.
customer_reviews.author: David A Breault

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install, solid good looking piece of hardware and WORKS!
customer_reviews.author: shaylc1985

customer_reviews.title: Failed after 4 months
customer_reviews.text: Product failed after 4 months, but the manufacturer worked with me to remedy the situation. I'll be receiving a new water cooler from deepcool and I hope to remain a customer for many years after receiving this level of customer service.
customer_reviews.author: Sherri Dutcher

customer_reviews.title: Really easy to install
customer_reviews.text: Have the white model 3 in my white PC and it looks beautiful when it's running so far haven't had an issue about three months.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan h.

customer_reviews.title: Same performance as any "higher end" AIO, but a lot less $.
customer_reviews.text: Great 240 AIO. Keeps my Ryzen 1600 under 52c on extended Aida 64 stress testing at 3.8ghz and 1.35 volts at the bios "silent" fan curve.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Once you go liquid, you don't go back
customer_reviews.text: This was my first attempt at water cooling, it won't be my last.
customer_reviews.author: TechnoTim

customer_reviews.title: amazing pump, really nice radiator but the fans seem ...
customer_reviews.text: Put the 240ez on my 3770k and oc to 4.2 with 87c at full load in prime, amazing pump, really nice radiator but the fans seem to lack some although even at full speed the pump and fans are really quiet in a Thor v2. Could oc way further if voltages were touched.
customer_reviews.author: Jdawg

customer_reviews.title: I would recommend it
customer_reviews.text: Looks very sleek and works well, just make sure your case can accommodate it. I would recommend it
customer_reviews.author: Salemm

customer_reviews.title: Nice looking, cools my Ryzen 7 1700@3
customer_reviews.text: Nice looking, cools my Ryzen 7 1700@3.8G@1.325V with no more than 70°C when stressing FPU. White looks also match my build scene. Nice job DeepCool!
customer_reviews.author: Kiki

customer_reviews.title: Easy install, keeps the cpu cool.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent cooler, install was easy. When i first turn my computer on when it is cold outside which makes my room cold, i get as low as 25 degrees Celsius, and then it goes up and averages 40-50 degrees Celsius while gaming.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Blessing

customer_reviews.title: Make sure you have space between you radiator and cpu so the lines don’t kink or hit the board
customer_reviews.text: I just with the lines were longer allowing better placement for the radiator
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very effective cooler and also looks amazing. No troubles installing
customer_reviews.text: Very effective cooler and also looks amazing. No troubles installing. I wish the cooling hoses were a little longer but still made it work with my build. Couldn't be happier with this!
customer_reviews.author: Joshua B.

customer_reviews.title: good product
customer_reviews.text: installing was very easy was not difficult at all. my only complaint is that the pulsating LED does not work for me. but it really doesn't bother me.
customer_reviews.author: hunter

customer_reviews.title: I love it
customer_reviews.text: Great liquid cooler beats Corsair in my opinion nice for all white builds
customer_reviews.author: Meat

customer_reviews.title: is not easy to assemble as other product
customer_reviews.text: The RGP does not work anymore. Also, is not easy to assemble as other product.
customer_reviews.author: Abdulaziz Albayhi

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY!!!
customer_reviews.text: O-ring came loose dripping liquid on and ruining graphics card.
customer_reviews.author: Cole

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: This cooler is a beast. No problem installing and starting. A good price for what it does imo.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works good and looks good
customer_reviews.text: Keeps my i7 6700 at ~30 C idle and ~ 50 C load. I replaced the fans for a custom rig but the stock ones are pretty good and quiet. There seems to be a bit of air inside the loop though with the occasional gurgle.
customer_reviews.author: Jenna Castellanos

customer_reviews.title: Looks great on my pc
customer_reviews.text: Looks great on my pc. It keeps my cpu at about 20 c almost all the time. Hasnt broken or leaked so far so thats good. Im hoping it stays that way. I use customs fans so I kept the ones provided with it in the box
customer_reviews.author: Consumerism

customer_reviews.title: Looked and operated great! for at least 2 boot cycles....ugh
customer_reviews.text: I purchased and installed into my system and it worked perfectly, however by the 3rd boot the strobe light dimmed to almost nothing and became a flash rather than a strobe. Having the strobe assured me that the device was working properly, now without that assurance I may just uninstall and put a Hyper212 on it. Deepcool was no help and I am not sure if this has gone beyond the date to return to Amazon. Very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Tony A.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome CPU Cooler!
customer_reviews.text: Good looking cooler and keeps CPU temps low while gaming. Helped with my vertical graphics card mount mod for the case. Wouldn't fit with an air cooler so I had to get a water cooler. Super easy install. Would purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: TaChido

customer_reviews.title: More Aesthetic than AIO water cooler.
customer_reviews.text: The item is visually great but it's cooling is a bit less than any Corsair i've tried. It idles around 41c rather than 30c or less while OC'd with any corsair AIO. Maybe someone who has no intent of OCing their processor will be able to add visually with this but I can't. I added white LED fans from Corsair to it in the picture added. Corsair also has new PRO White LED fans which are substantially better and more quiet. I'd say use those.
customer_reviews.author: MWMullens

customer_reviews.title: Do NOT buy this, please!
customer_reviews.text: All I can tell you is: Do NOT believe the hype. Do your homework. Mine was broken on arrival. Luckily I didn't install it & have to worry about all of the leaking issues that you'll find. Like I said, do your research, PLEASE
customer_reviews.author: nappydrew

customer_reviews.title: Gaming for the right price.
customer_reviews.text: This Deepcool is keeping my Core I5 8600k at bay. Love how easy it was to install.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

product_meta.title: DEEPCOOL Captain 240EX White AIO Liquid CPU Cooler, White LED Waterblock, 240mm Radiator, Dual 120mm Black PWM Fans, White, AM4 Compatible, 3-Year Warranty

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.2 out of 5 stars168 ratings4.2 out of 5 stars
